content: the aren scarf is a small accessory that can be worn in various ways as a fine scarf or tie as a belt as headwear as an ornament on bags it features a textured stitch shown in a video tutorial slipped stitch edges and can be made into any desired length the pattern provides instructions on how to create a gradient using any number of colours either holding two strands of fingering weight or one strand of dk weight **yarn ** you will need about 350 m 385 yds of fingering weight yarn to be held double or 175 m 195 yds of dk weight yarn the sample was knit using bulbe bizarre sock extrafine 400 m 437 yds / 100 g in a gradient set of 9 colours for their 2024 yarn calendar yarn was gifted for the design note that using fingering weight held double will make the gradient easier but the pattern also provides instructions to create a gradient effect with a single strand of dk weight the design can also be worked in a single colour or in various stripe patterns **needles ** main needles 4 mm us 6 or size required to get gauge **gauge ** 32 5 sts x 38 row per 10 cm 4 in knot stitch after blocking note that a different gauge will affect size and yarn usage **size ** 4 cm 1 ½ wide the pattern provides instructions to work any desired length suggested lengths for a belt to fit a waist circumference of 65 75 / 85 / 95 105 / 115 / 125 / 135 cm 25 ½ 29 ½ / 33 ½ / 37 ½ 41 ¼ / 45 ¼ / 49 ¼/ 53 ¼ actual belt length measurement 105 120 / 135 / 145 155 / 165 / 170 / 175 cm 41 ¼ 47 ¼ / 53 ¼ / 57 61 / 65 / 67 / 69 to wear aren as a scarf work a minimum length of 140 cm 55 the sample was worked to a 140 cm 55 length **notions ** tapestry needle and scissors row counter recommended **techniques used ** scarf / belt worked sideways simple increases and decreases centered double decrease slipped stitch edges knot stitch video tutorial included instructions to create a gradient pattern includes charted and written instructions 350 m de fil fingering à tenir en double ou de 175 m de fil
